conclusion: To determine if the two cars will collide, analyze the velocity-time graphs of the car and the truck.
The image shows two velocity-time graphs. Graph a represents the car, starting at 30 m/s and decreasing over time. Graph b represents the truck, traveling at a constant speed of 10 m/s.
The car starts at 30 m/s and follows graph a. The car's velocity decreases over time, eventually reaching 0 m/s.
The truck travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s, as shown by graph b.
The car needs to stop before the truck reaches it. The time it takes for the car to stop can be found by analyzing graph a.
The truck travels 30 meters at 10 m/s. The time taken for the truck to cover this distance is 30 meters / 10 m/s = 3 seconds.
If the car stops before 3 seconds, they will not collide. Otherwise, they will collide.
By examining graph a, the car stops before 3 seconds, indicating that they will not collide.
